result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevionta T Patterson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevionta T Patterson appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for Kevionta T Patterson. Prosecuting Attorney Careen Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; on leave. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defense counsel requested status conference adjournment due to case scheduled for a preliminary hearing for October 31, 2022 at 8:30 am. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 04. Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevionta T Patterson appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for Kevionta T Patterson.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present due to a training. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Kevionta T Patterson in court.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. PD's office unable to appoint counsel. Court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense due to no appointment by the state.  The court appointed Attorney Joseph Bastien to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant DOES NOT HAVE to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees for reason stated on the record. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Atty Joseph Bastien in court and accepts appointment. Court found GOOD CAUSE for waiver of time limits. Case set for prelim in prelim court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Kevionta T Patterson in court with attorney Thomas Holland Reed.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for State V Lee hearing. Matter set for status of counsel. Court finds good cause to extend preliminary time limits for representation to be appointed. Case remains calendared in Br 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Kevionta T Patterson in court by video.   Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Kevionta T Patterson in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Kevionta T Patterson in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Court ordered no contact with Gerald D.A.; Pamela S.; Krishna C.; and co-defendants
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kevionta T Patterson in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Kevionta T Patterson in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevionta T Patterson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 5 and 6.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
